indications: Indications tuberculosis in combination with other drugs [unlicensed]
name: PYRAZINAMIDE
cautions:
Cautions see Monitoring in notes above; also diabetes; gout (avoid in acute attack); interactions: Appendix 1
(pyrazinamide)Hepatic disorders Patients or their
carers should be told how to recognise signs of liver disorder, and
advised to discontinue treatment and seek immediate medical attention
if symptoms such as persistent nausea, vomiting, malaise or jaundice
develop
side-effects:
Side-effects hepatotoxicity including fever, anorexia, hepatomegaly,
splenomegaly, jaundice, liver failure; nausea, vomiting, flushing,
dysuria, arthralgia, sideroblastic anaemia, thrombocytopenia, rash
and occasionally photosensitivity
pregnancy:
Pregnancy manufacturer advises use only if potential benefit
outweighs risk; see also Pregnancy
